text: Hi people! - does anyone know if it is possible to add a Google analytics goal to the HubSpot chat?

I'm trying to just globally redirect pages on a migrated site from a .aspx version to a no-extension version. I've got a flexible redirect rule set up as `/:url.aspx` to `/{url}`. I don't think it's working. Is there a way to do this?
I also tried `/*url.aspx`, but I don't think that's it either
they’ve been considering different options. Slack’s pricing plans don’t make sense for this HubSpot dev community(way too expensive and not scalable enough)

the lowest plan would cost an astronomical amount: $9764.88

The enterprise grid I believe they already contact Slack about. odds are the pricing just wouldn’t fit what they’re doing with this slack
Yes I understand it's unfortunately expensive
This is a random question that I cant seem to find the answer to in the docs. If want to add an ‘extra’ domain to my portal just for redirects, does that cost money just to add the domain?

Hey <@U89DUQGKD>, here's HubSpot's help article on connecting a domain to HubSpot - <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/connect-a-domain-to-HubSpot#connect-your-domain-and-copy-your-cname>
In the bulleted list under 'Connect your domain and copy your CNAME' there's a brief description for connecting a redirected domain.
TL:DR - this should not cost extra, as redirected domains do not require you to purchase an additional brand domain (only need BD for primary/secondary domains.)
ahhh, thats what I was looking for. Thanks!

Hey Ian, it looks like your approach would work for that first level subdirectory. I wrote up an answer to something similar in the designers forum yesterday (<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/flexible-pattern-URL-mapping-html-site-to-COS/m-p/247904#M10750>) if you wanted to check that out. It would be pretty similar just replace .html with your .aspx
Ah, that makes sense. Thanks!
No problem :thumbsup:
I'm also trying to do one from `/blog?tag=/:tag` to `/blog/tag/{tag}`, but that doesn't seem to work either. Any suggestions on that?
Hey Ian could you try /blog?tag=:tag > /blog/tag{tag}
That looks to work on my end.
That doesn't seem to work either :disappointed:
HS Support said that sometimes it takes time for these things to become active, so I'll look again in a bit I guess

Perfect, sounds good. Yeah it can take a few minutes for each of these to load. When testing on my own site, that last one seemed to do the trick. The one you had originally sent over wasn't working on my end as well. I'd also make sure you're checking the priority of the redirect (e.g. if there is another redirect that matches that pattern that will take place first).
Still doesn't seem to work
Hey Ian, I'll PM you.

<@UEC65BQV8> could you put your image assets in a directory named similarly to the CDN path? so that way, all you'd have to do is replace the `file_manager` prefix with the cdn URL, and that could be done in bulk via script/command line
thats what I am thinking I will probably end up doing. run a little prod script before uploading.

<@UEKMY50SU> on this topic, is there good documentation  on the template folder vs the design folder when ftping? I don't see the point of the template folder if it is so restrictive on what you can/can't upload
I am just uploading my html/hubl files into the design folder for now
I believe that the `template/` directory you see in FTP is soon-to-be deprecated, and the `design/` folder is what it is being replaced with
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/HubSpot-ftp> briefly mentions this
The `designs/` directory corresponds to the project structure of the new design manager
"Briefly" being the operative word here...
so safe to say just use designs/?
are you on the design manager beta?
i'm not positive of the behavior if you're not on the beta and upload to the designs directory, but <@UBDMV6Y9Y> might know better
What I have looks like this, so beta zone I guess?
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/introduction-to-the-design-manager>
:thumbsup:
does anybody know if i can move a form from a portal to another?

I believe we don’t allow uploading to `/designs` if you’re not on the new Design Manager. If you are on the new Design Manager, you should definitely use `designs`. For now `templates` only exists to support the legacy tools / old scripts.
<@U2PDTMH53> Maybe unconventional but you could add it to a form module on a template and move the template to the new portal
tried, but the form doesn’t move with :disappointed:
what’s so special about this form?

<@U2PDTMH53> I haven’t personally ever done this but theoretically you might be able to use the API’s to get the form fields etc, and then use the api to create new forms on the other portal
Kinda like a Copy form to portal tool.

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/v2/get_form>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/v2/create_form>

If you go that method I think you should make it an open source project I could see others finding that super useful. especially if they could take your tool then make it support bulk amounts of forms
So looks like this is still an issue with its on a page where the JS is 100% firing

<@U38EZFVFE> and <@UE24LMGSZ> quick question, thoughts on if I let that image load but set an inline style on it to be 0 width and height and then just adding link text after it, it would technically still let the image load so that should track the "view" and then the link would be the click correct?
basically tricking it a bit
So you are adding text in addition to the cta?
yup, would be adding in text inside the `<a>` element
where the normal img tag sits
via js?
nope just modifying the embed code as this is on a non-hs site

Example:
```
<!--HubSpot Call-to-Action Code --><span class="hs-cta-wrapper" id="hs-cta-wrapper-897f9da5-ec8d-43f1-bef0-28658812a814"><span class="hs-cta-node hs-cta-897f9da5-ec8d-43f1-bef0-28658812a814" id="hs-cta-897f9da5-ec8d-43f1-bef0-28658812a814"><!--[if lte IE 8]><div id="hs-cta-ie-element"></div><![endif]--><a href="<https://cta-redirect.HubSpot.com/cta/redirect/1234567890>" ><img class="hs-cta-img" id="hs-cta-img-897f9da5-ec8d-43f1-bef0-28658812a814" style="border-width:0px;WIDTH:0;HEIGHT:0;" src="<https://no-cache.HubSpot.com/cta/default/1234567890.png>"  alt="alt text here"/>  ***** ADDING IN TEXT HERE *******  </a></span><script charset="utf-8" src="<https://js.hscta.net/cta/current.js>"></script><script type="text/javascript"> hbspt.cta.load(999999, '1234567890, {}); </script></span><!-- end HubSpot Call-to-Action Code -->
```
Ahh i see
yeah you can do that
You can just remove the Image I think
not sure they use that for tracking purposes
but the issue i think is less image loading and more is the JS loading.
im going to do that. We'll see if it work lol
yea JS loads no problem on this one
ok
Anyone know how to get the date field in the contact property to be a time field as well?
I noticed on some contacts there are date time fields like "create date" but I cant find a way to make those types of fields. Only can make them showing just date...
anybody know how to prevent prebuilt form css from loading? I am going to overwrite it all anyway
how are you using the forms?
on HubSpot pages? drag and drop template?
coding some local templates before uploading to DM. Silly me, didn't realize they load in an iframe though...
yah … by default used in HubSpot templates they come with very little styling

Is your question coding related <@UFQ5D7Q05>? If it is, this is a good place to get technical coding help.

If it is not coding related, the <http://help.HubSpot.com|help.HubSpot.com> is the best place to go.
If you have technical HubSpot coding questions... please clearly outline the problem and include screenshots or code snippets. This will help the community understand and help.

We're actively exploring this topic in Q1 and Q2 ... We're experimenting with a few options now actually.

Slack paid plans is too expensive for us to do... it's just not made for large communities.
Hope to have a better solution to archiving, searching, etc. by mid year.... but all the solutions will require a pretty big investment.

If you're on enterprise ... there might be a way with the custom chat bot options.
-or-
(not sure this would actually work) If you're goal is simply "started chat: Y/N" ... you could experiment with wrapping the JS embed code where the chat is implemented.

You could ask this in <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Sales-Hub-Tools/bd-p/sales_tools>  ... some folks there miiiiight know too.
